outline:
1. to tie, bind, imprison
    1. (Qal)
      1. to tie, bind
      2. to tie, harness
      3. to bind (with cords)
      4. to gird (rare and late)
      5. to begin the battle, make the attack
      6. of obligation of oath (figurative)
    2. (Niphal) to be imprisoned, bound
    3. (Pual) to be taken prisoner
kjv_def: bind, fast, gird, harness, hold, keep, make ready, order, prepare, prison(-er), put in bonds, set in array, tie.
strongs_def: to yoke or hitch; by analogy, to fasten in any sense, to join battle
